In Victorian England, the independent and headstrong Bathsheba Everdene attracts three very different suitors: Gabriel Oak, a sheep farmer; Frank Troy, a reckless Sergeant; and William Boldwood, a prosperous and mature bachelor." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2935476/","name":"Far from the Madding Crowd","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzI4NzUwNDgwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTI3MjMwNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In Victorian England, the independent and headstrong Bathsheba Everdene attracts three very different suitors: Gabriel Oak, a sheep farmer; Frank Troy, a reckless Sergeant; and William Boldwood, a prosperous and mature bachelor.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2935476/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"KateC49"},"dateCreated":"2015-07-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Exquisitley filmed but lacks the energy of the first (1967) film","reviewBody":"This has always been one of my favourite books & films and I was keen to see what they did with this a second time around. But what I want to say after seeing it was 1/see the first film 2/read the book. One of the most essential points to film was left out altogether in that when Bathsheba sent her 'joke' valentine to Boldwood she wrote the words 'Marry Me' on it. IMDb data; ttnr: 2935476, Title: Far from the Madding Crowd, --- Description: Far from the Madding Crowd: Directed by Thomas Vinterberg. With Carey Mulligan, Matthias Schoenaerts, Tilly Vosburgh, Mark Wingett. In Victorian England, the independent and headstrong Bathsheba Everdene attracts three very different suitors: Gabriel Oak, a sheep farmer; Frank Troy, a reckless Sergeant; and William Boldwood, a prosperous and mature bachelor." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2935476/","name":"Far from the Madding Crowd","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzI4NzUwNDgwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTI3MjMwNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In Victorian England, the independent and headstrong Bathsheba Everdene attracts three very different suitors: Gabriel Oak, a sheep farmer; Frank Troy, a reckless Sergeant; and William Boldwood, a prosperous and mature bachelor.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2935476/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"KateC49","dateCreated":"2015-07-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Exquisitley filmed but lacks the energy of the first (1967) film","reviewBody":"This has always been one of my favourite books & films and I was keen to see what they did with this a second time around. But what I want to say after seeing it was 1/see the first film 2/read the book. One of the most essential points to film was left out altogether in that when Bathsheba sent her 'joke' valentine to Boldwood she wrote the words 'Marry Me' on it. It wasn't the roses-are-red etc that got Boldwood in a twist it was the two words she wrote on the card. We get no sense of the quandary and deliberating over this that went on within Boldwood for some time before he made his move (and his ultimate obsession) in this film as we do in the first.

I think the scene when Fanny got the wrong church was disappointing as well. There was no sense of the mad dash she had across town to find the right church and only to find Frank striding out full of indignation at being stood up and telling her "It's too late!" The beautiful words of Gabriel to Bathsheba "when I look up there ye will be and when you look up there I will be" just don't feature at all.

The "shooting at the end was tame to say the least & Martin Sheen was much less forceful in his insistence of marrying Bathsheba But I did like Carey Mulligan as Bathdheba. What was missing was the energy & drama the original film had and dare I say it some Wessex accents....","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":47755,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.1,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2015-05-01","keywords":"farm,sheep,three men in love with the same woman,based on novel,playing","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2575019545","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIyNTMzMjA4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzMyNzE1NDE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjIyNTMzMjA4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzMyNzE1NDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"In Victorian England, the independent and headstrong Bathsheba Everdene attracts three very different suitors: Gabriel Oak, a sheep farmer; Frank Troy, a reckless Sergeant; and William Boldwood, a prosperous and mature bachelor.
","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1659547/","name":"Carey Mulligan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0774386/","name":"Matthias Schoenaerts","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0790688/","name":"Michael Sheen"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0899121/","name":"Thomas Vinterberg"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0028932/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0420822/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0362762/","name":"Thomas Hardy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0390141/","name":"David Nicholls"],"duration":"PT1H59M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Denmark
Danska
programme.desc:
Denmark: Directed by Adrian Shergold. With Rafe Spall, Darren Evans, Elis James, Joel Fry. A down-on-his-luck Welshman travels across Europe with one crazy goal: to get himself arrested and sent to a Danish prison where the beds are warm and the water is hot." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7037712/","name":"Denmark","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1ZTI5ODgtYjgwZC00MzY5LWIzNWQtNTE5NWY0MGVmMjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQ5MzY0NjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A down-on-his-luck Welshman travels across Europe with one crazy goal: to get himself arrested and sent to a Danish prison where the beds are warm and the water is hot.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7037712/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"fallyhag"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A rather fortunate story with a realistic feel","reviewBody":"The lead is Unquestionably an excellent actor. The film felt realistic. Moody, downbeat and desperate. I could feel his stress. I felt for the character. Even if I didn't really get to know him too well.

I could understand the move to Denmark but the journey there was very fortunate. It relied on sparse filming and vague story telling. You have to just accept he went from UK to Denmark in the blink of an eye and with a lot of luck.

The love interest was also another very fortunate bit of story telling. It really did start to stretch reality a little. The speed of him being alone to having dinner was a challenge. No real attempt to create a loving romance.

But this disbelief would be dwarfed by the gun And police station scenes. It was like they run out of time and tossed a coin for the ending. Super rushed and super convenient. The ending very anti-climatic, yet Subtle and A little understated.

This is not a comedy. It is a young man at the end. Hopeless. Finding a reason not to give up. The acting was good so it was easy to travel the story. I wanted more from it but what I got was okay. The lead actor is appearing in a lot of productions just lately and this film explains why. I believed his character story so that is a credit to him. I do recommend it but save it for a chilled afternoon. #WearaMask","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1329,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-07-20","keywords":"one word title,country in title,dog,bus,riding a motorbike","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1417592345","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTIwODJlNWEtYjRlZC00MWQ1LWFlMjQtNDhlNjhjODk5NDU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTIwODJlNWEtYjRlZC00MWQ1LWFlMjQtNDhlNjhjODk5NDU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1245863/","name":"Rafe Spall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2362716/","name":"Darren Evans"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4629308/","name":"Elis James"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0792120/","name":"Adrian Shergold"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0199178/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0484683/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4074534/","name":"Jeff Murphy"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bez neba
programme.desc: Meksičko-američko granično područje prepuno nasilja i dvoje mladih koji nastoje održati svoju ljubav u središtu su ove kratkometražne drame. U gradiću na granici SAD-a i Meksika, čarolija prve ljubavi opasno je prekinuta kada se dječak koji svim sredstvima pomaže svojoj obitelji nehotice zatekne usred nasilne mreže trgovine ljudima nakon što djevojka koju voli bude oteta.

programme.desc:
The Racer: Directed by Kieron J. Walsh. With Louis Talpe, Matteo Simoni, Tara Lee, Iain Glen. It follows a rider who, after being dropped from the team, is reinstated following a doping error." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8374436/","name":"The Racer","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjZiNDIzYTktMTY5OC00MzU5LWE2NDItYTg2YWY4ZDMzNDFmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDM2NDM2MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"It follows a rider who, after being dropped from the team, is reinstated following a doping error.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8374436/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"portrushme"},"dateCreated":"2021-04-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"Just appallingly woeful","reviewBody":"Thought I would give this a watch but it is truly awful. If you think this is what the Tour de France looks like and how a professional cyclist would conduct himself, then you will be having the wool pulled over your eyes.

The action scenes are truly laughable and I am sure of more than one occasion, the director of the film had the Irish flag the wrong way round. What cyclist goes to the pub on the evening of the race start lol

programme.title: Days of Heaven
Božanstveni dani
programme.desc: Days of Heaven: Directed by Terrence Malick. With Richard Gere, Brooke Adams, Sam Shepard, Linda Manz. A hot-tempered farm laborer convinces the woman he loves to marry their rich but dying boss so that they can have a claim to his fortune." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0077405/","name":"Days of Heaven","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjMyZmU4OGYtNjBiYS00YTIxLWJjMDUtZjczZmQwMTM4YjQxXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTI4MjkwNjA@._V1_.jpg","description":"A hot-tempered farm laborer convinces the woman he loves to marry their rich but dying boss so that they can have a claim to his fortune.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0077405/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"katsat"},"dateCreated":"2002-03-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"One of the most haunting and beautiful films ever made","reviewBody":"If any movie could be called filmed poetry, this would be it. From its first opening shot to its last frame, there is such lyricism and emotion and beauty that it almost leaves you speechless. I have not seen this movie in years, but it still affects me and I want to write about it. There is a pervading sadness to the movie, like a memory of something wonderful that could have been, that should have been, that almost was, and is all the more tragic because it was in your hands but slipped through your fingers. This is not a movie for everyone, but if you believe that film can be one of the highest forms of art, this is the film to see.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":55962,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"1978-10-06","keywords":"farm,train,wealth,farm worker,seasonal work","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi320650777","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzJiMmI5OWYtMzFiNC00NjYyLWJhNzctOWViM2VmOTM2YWE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzJiMmI5OWYtMzFiNC00NjYyLWJhNzctOWViM2VmOTM2YWE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000152/","name":"Richard Gere"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000724/","name":"Brooke Adams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001731/","name":"Sam Shepard"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000517/","name":"Terrence Malick"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023400/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000517/","name":"Terrence Malick"}],"duration":"PT1H34M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Denmark
Danska
programme.desc:
Denmark: Directed by Adrian Shergold. With Rafe Spall, Darren Evans, Elis James, Joel Fry. A down-on-his-luck Welshman travels across Europe with one crazy goal: to get himself arrested and sent to a Danish prison where the beds are warm and the water is hot." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7037712/","name":"Denmark","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjI1ZTI5ODgtYjgwZC00MzY5LWIzNWQtNTE5NWY0MGVmMjA4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzQ5MzY0NjM@._V1_.jpg","description":"A down-on-his-luck Welshman travels across Europe with one crazy goal: to get himself arrested and sent to a Danish prison where the beds are warm and the water is hot.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7037712/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"fallyhag"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"A rather fortunate story with a realistic feel","reviewBody":"The lead is Unquestionably an excellent actor. The film felt realistic. Moody, downbeat and desperate. I could feel his stress. I felt for the character. Even if I didn't really get to know him too well.

I could understand the move to Denmark but the journey there was very fortunate. It relied on sparse filming and vague story telling. You have to just accept he went from UK to Denmark in the blink of an eye and with a lot of luck.

The love interest was also another very fortunate bit of story telling. It really did start to stretch reality a little. The speed of him being alone to having dinner was a challenge. No real attempt to create a loving romance.

But this disbelief would be dwarfed by the gun And police station scenes. It was like they run out of time and tossed a coin for the ending. Super rushed and super convenient. The ending very anti-climatic, yet Subtle and A little understated.

This is not a comedy. It is a young man at the end. Hopeless. Finding a reason not to give up. The acting was good so it was easy to travel the story. I wanted more from it but what I got was okay. The lead actor is appearing in a lot of productions just lately and this film explains why. I believed his character story so that is a credit to him. I do recommend it but save it for a chilled afternoon. #WearaMask","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1329,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-07-20","keywords":"one word title,country in title,dog,bus,riding a motorbike","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1417592345","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTIwODJlNWEtYjRlZC00MWQ1LWFlMjQtNDhlNjhjODk5NDU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTIwODJlNWEtYjRlZC00MWQ1LWFlMjQtNDhlNjhjODk5NDU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1245863/","name":"Rafe Spall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2362716/","name":"Darren Evans"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4629308/","name":"Elis James"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0792120/","name":"Adrian Shergold"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103694/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0199178/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0484683/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4074534/","name":"Jeff Murphy"}],"duration":"PT1H31M"}</script><metacontent="

She has the sweet sixteen face and looks like a combination of Emma Roberts and Scarlett Johannsen. The director should have put an extra effort in adapting the book. For AR, Happy belated birthday!","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":20426,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Fantasy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2018-02-23","keywords":"singing in a car,mother daughter relationship,father daughter relationship,sister sister relationship,boyfriend girlfriend conflict","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1251457049","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDI5ZmQwZGItZmEwYy00ZThiLWJjOTgtM2MyZWM1NjEzMTc3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDI5ZmQwZGItZmEwYy00ZThiLWJjOTgtM2MyZWM1NjEzMTc3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"16-year-old Rhiannon falls in love with a mysterious spirit named "A" who inhabits a different body every day. Feeling an unmatched connection, Rhiannon and A work each day to find each other, not knowing what or who the next day will bring. The more the two fall in love, the more the realities of loving someone who is a different person every 24 hours takes a toll, leaving Rhiannon and "A" to face the hardest decision either has ever had to make."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3886028/","name":"Angourie Rice"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm6819854/","name":"Justice Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2913275/","name":"Debby Ryan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1302591/","name":"Michael Sucsy"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0190175/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0470082/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0296441/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5428959/","name":"Jesse Andrews"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2832819/","name":"David Levithan"}],"duration":"PT1H37M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Good Liar
Savršena laž
programme.desc:
The Good Liar: Directed by Bill Condon. With Helen Mirren, Ian McKellen, Russell Tovey, Jim Carter. Consummate con man Roy Courtnay has set his sights on his latest mark: the recently widowed Betty McLeish, worth millions. But this time, what should have been a simple swindle escalates into a cat-and-mouse game with the ultimate stakes." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5563334/","name":"The Good Liar","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BN2VhNTY5ZTUtYzc1NC00NjUyLWI1NDQtYWE3YmJlNjQ3OGVlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Consummate con man Roy Courtnay has set his sights on his latest mark: the recently widowed Betty McLeish, worth millions. But this time, what should have been a simple swindle escalates into a cat-and-mouse game with the ultimate st","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5563334/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"tm-sheehan"},"dateCreated":"2019-12-06","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Masterclass in Great Acting","reviewBody":"My Review : The Good Liar my rating 8.5

No Spoilers as usual from me except to say the trailers of The Good Liar give us only an inkling into the complex maze the plot reveals and that it's a master class in great acting from Sir Ian McKellen and Dame Helen Mirren.

I think it's the finest performance from Ian McKellen since his Oscar nominated role in Gods and Monsters in 1999 and I'm not surprised that Bill Condon the director of this film also directed Ian McKellen in Gods and Monsters.

In The Good Liar Ian McKellen is cast as Roy Courtnay who meets Helen Mirren cast as Betty McLeish on a mature age dating site it soon becomes apparently clear that Roy's motives are not honourable in any way shape or form it takes us a lot longer to reveal Betty's true motive. In the meantime we meet Betty's hunky handsome protective Grandson Stephen perfectly played by Russell Tovey who seeks out to find out all he can about his Grandmother's new border and boyfriend.

Jim Carter who plays Mr Carson in Downton Abbey is very impressive in the very different role of Vincent the best friend of Roy Courtney and "business associate " it's a great ensemble cast and this film has some great plot twisters and surprises that at times may seem a little improbable but that didn't bother me a bit.

It's the performances of McKellen and Mirren that are sublime, subtle and mesmerising the range of these two actors is astonishing when you think back to characters like Helen Mirren in The Queen or Catherine the Great and Maria Altman in Woman in Gold then Ian McKellen as Gandalf or James Whale in Gods and Monsters and King Lear to see them together in a film for the first time ,they have appeared on stage together in 2001 in Dance of Death on Broadway.

I must mention the great score by Carter Burwell it's perfect and gives great atmosphere to the emotional and suspenseful plot I really like his scores and this is up with his previous film scores for Carol, Three Billboards Outside Ebbing ,Missouri and In Bruges.

I really enjoyed The Good Liar go see it and don't let anyone tell you the outcome of this complex story.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":35420,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2019-11-08","keywords":"con artist,elderly gigolo,past coming back to haunt,online dating,flashback","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1183235865","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODA1MzY0NzMtYTM1ZS00YTZiLTk3MWItMjlmZDVhYTQyMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODA1MzY0NzMtYTM1ZS00YTZiLTk3MWItMjlmZDVhYTQyMDJhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000545/","name":"Helen Mirren"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005212/","name":"Ian McKellen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0869871/","name":"Russell Tovey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0174374/","name":"Bill Condon"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0309252/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0465018/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0046718/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8006852/","name":"Nicholas Searle"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0368774/","name":"Jeffrey Hatcher"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

If you think this is what the Tour de France looks like and how a professional cyclist would conduct himself, then you will be having the wool pulled over your eyes.

The action scenes are truly laughable and I am sure of more than one occasion, the director of the film had the Irish flag the wrong way round. What cyclist goes to the pub on the evening of the race start lol

programme.title: Agatha and the Curse of Ishtar
Agatha and the Curse of Ishtar
programme.desc: Agatha and the Curse of Ishtar: Directed by Sam Yates. With Jonah Hauer-King, Lyndsey Marshal, Bronagh Waugh, Jack Deam. On an archaeological dig in Iraq, author Agatha Christie uncovers a series of murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10964992/","name":"Agatha and the Curse of Ishtar","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTNhNTQ3MzUtNDk3MC00OWQyLTgwYjMtYzk3YWM2YjRiOGE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTY3NTk5OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"On an archaeological dig in Iraq, author Agatha Christie uncovers a series of murders.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10964992/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Tweekums"},"dateCreated":"2019-12-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"A fun murder mystery","reviewBody":"This, the second story to imagine authoress Agatha Christie to be caught up in a murder mystery of her own, sees her travelling to Iraq to stay with friends at an archaeological dig. Before she gets there young archaeologist, Max, finds a body. This is put down to a snake bite but it soon becomes apparent that something is afoot. When Agatha arrives she finds Max injured by a bullet wound in the head and not long afterwards when she gets to the house where those involved in the dig are staying a pet monkey is found hanged! She thinks this is more than mere animal cruelty so, with the help of Max, performs an autopsy. The results make her certain that the dead man was killed something other than a snake. In the investigation that follows she grows close to Max while exposing a plot to steal artefacts and ultimately identifying the killer.\n\nIf you can get beyond the conceit of placing a real crime writer in a fictional murder mystery this rather fun. This fictionalised Agatha is a good protagonist and the mystery provides plenty of suspects. As well as the central mystery there is a degree of romance which doesn't distract from the main story. The thing that surprised me most about this production was the degree of humour; there were laughs from start to finish. These were unforced rather than obvious gags and added to my enjoyment. The cast is solid, most notably Lyndsey Marshal who is charming as Agatha and Jonah Hauer King, who plays Max. Obviously it couldn't be filmed in Iraq but the Maltese locations used have a suitably Middle Eastern look. Overall I'd certainly recommend this to fans of classic murder mysteries.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2185,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6},"genre":["Crime","Mystery","Romance"],"datePublished":"2019-12-15","keywords":"crime novelist,archaeologist,archaeology,iraq,murder","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5999355/","name":"Jonah Hauer-King"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1203457/","name":"Lyndsey Marshal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2391026/","name":"Bronagh Waugh"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7537695/","name":"Sam Yates"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000130/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0800044/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3666261/","name":"Tom Dalton"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

On an archaeological dig in Iraq, author Agatha Christie uncovers a series of murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10964992/","name":"Agatha and the Curse of Ishtar","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZTNhNTQ3MzUtNDk3MC00OWQyLTgwYjMtYzk3YWM2YjRiOGE1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTY3NTk5OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"On an archaeological dig in Iraq, author Agatha Christie uncovers a series of murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10964992/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Tweekums","dateCreated":"2019-12-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"A fun murder mystery","reviewBody":"This, the second story to imagine authoress Agatha Christie to be caught up in a murder mystery of her own, sees her travelling to Iraq to stay with friends at an archaeological dig. Before she gets there young archaeologist, Max, finds a body. This is put down to a snake bite but it soon becomes apparent that something is afoot. When Agatha arrives she finds Max injured by a bullet wound in the head and not long afterwards when she gets to the house where those involved in the dig are staying a pet monkey is found hanged! She thinks this is more than mere animal cruelty so, with the help of Max, performs an autopsy. The results make her certain that the dead man was killed something other than a snake. In the investigation that follows she grows close to Max while exposing a plot to steal artefacts and ultimately identifying the killer.\n\nIf you can get beyond the conceit of placing a real crime writer in a fictional murder mystery this rather fun. This fictionalised Agatha is a good protagonist and the mystery provides plenty of suspects. As well as the central mystery there is a degree of romance which doesn't distract from the main story. The thing that surprised me most about this production was the degree of humour; there were laughs from start to finish. These were unforced rather than obvious gags and added to my enjoyment. The cast is solid, most notably Lyndsey Marshal who is charming as Agatha and Jonah Hauer King, who plays Max. Obviously it couldn't be filmed in Iraq but the Maltese locations used have a suitably Middle Eastern look. Overall I'd certainly recommend this to fans of classic murder mysteries.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2185,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6,"genre":["Crime","Mystery","Romance"],"datePublished":"2019-12-15","keywords":"crime novelist,archaeologist,archaeology,iraq,murder","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5999355/","name":"Jonah Hauer-King","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1203457/","name":"Lyndsey Marshal","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2391026/","name":"Bronagh Waugh"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7537695/","name":"Sam Yates"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000130/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0800044/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3666261/","name":"Tom Dalton"],"duration":"PT1H35M"</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 1091909, Title: Murdoch Mysteries, --- Description: Murdoch Mysteries: Created by Cal Coons, Alexandra Zarowny, Maureen Jennings, Bob Carney. With Yannick Bisson, Helene Joy, Thomas Craig, Jonny Harris. In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

All Creatures Great and Small: With Nicholas Ralph, Anna Madeley, Samuel West, Rachel Shenton. The numerous adventures of a friendly staff at a country veterinarian practice in 1930s to 1940s Yorkshire." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt10590066/","name":"All Creatures Great and Small","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZGU5NGRiMjAtMTJhYy00ZmNjLWJiNzktYTMwZTNhNzI1NTM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDk3ODk4OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"The numerous adventures of a friendly staff at a country veterinarian practice in 1930s to 1940s Yorkshire.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10590066/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Sleepin_Dragon"},"dateCreated":"2020-09-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"I wasn't expecting that.","reviewBody":"I think it's fair to say that some, myself included wrote this off before it had even aired, Channel five hasn't really been known for original drama. I was definitely wrong, it's a great watch.

Channel Five has a real winner with his show, it is truly the tonic we need for 2020, it's uplifting, sentimental, it has a real feel good factor.

A winner in all areas, great stories, terrific acting, and a warmth that has been lacking in shows for some time.

How lovely to see Diana Rigg appear, ahead of her tragic death.

Bang on the money, 9/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6292,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.5},"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2020-09-01","keywords":"yorkshire,veterinarian,countryside,rural setting,1930s","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11013770/","name":"Nicholas Ralph"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0534777/","name":"Anna Madeley"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0922335/","name":"Samuel West"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0361727/"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2069741081","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDYyMjM4MDMtMjA5My00ZDI3LTlhNjctNjU4YjhkMzJiMjE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDYyMjM4MDMtMjA5My00ZDI3LTlhNjctNjU4YjhkMzJiMjE4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Since their first publication in 1970, the beloved books of James Alfred Wight, published under the pen name James Herriot, have held a special place in people’s hearts throughout the world. Chronicling the heartwarming and humorous adventures of a young country vet, the books introduced readers to his unconventional mentor and the cast of farmers and townsfolk who lived and worked in the Yorkshire Dales in the 1930s.

This new television adaptation will preserve the rich spirit, tone and values of Herriot’s iconic characters and stories and will bring to life his sharply observed, entertaining and incredibly funny tales of country life in the North of England for a modern audience, introducing a new generation to his life-affirming stories."}}</script><metacontent="

Chronicling the heartwarming and humorous adventures of a young country vet, the books introduced readers to his unconventional mentor and the cast of farmers and townsfolk who lived and worked in the Yorkshire Dales in the 1930s.

This new television adaptation will preserve the rich spirit, tone and values of Herriot’s iconic characters and stories and will bring to life his sharply observed, entertaining and incredibly funny tales of country life in the North of England for a modern audience, introducing a new generation to his life-affirming stories."</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Murdoch Mysteries
Murdoch Mysteries
programme.sub-title: S6 E2 Winston's Lost Night
programme.desc:
Murdoch Mysteries: Created by Cal Coons, Alexandra Zarowny, Maureen Jennings, Bob Carney. With Yannick Bisson, Helene Joy, Thomas Craig, Jonny Harris. In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing"},"dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2},"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"}}</script><metacontent="

Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. There are three main reasons that I like MM.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

IMDb data; ttnr: 1091909, Title: Murdoch Mysteries, --- Description: Murdoch Mysteries: Created by Cal Coons, Alexandra Zarowny, Maureen Jennings, Bob Carney. With Yannick Bisson, Helene Joy, Thomas Craig, Jonny Harris. In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. IMDb data; ttnr: 1091909, Title: Murdoch Mysteries, --- Description: Murdoch Mysteries: Created by Cal Coons, Alexandra Zarowny, Maureen Jennings, Bob Carney. With Yannick Bisson, Helene Joy, Thomas Craig, Jonny Harris. In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 1091909, Title: Murdoch Mysteries, --- Description: Murdoch Mysteries: Created by Cal Coons, Alexandra Zarowny, Maureen Jennings, Bob Carney. With Yannick Bisson, Helene Joy, Thomas Craig, Jonny Harris. In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 1091909, Title: Murdoch Mysteries, --- Description: Murdoch Mysteries: Created by Cal Coons, Alexandra Zarowny, Maureen Jennings, Bob Carney. With Yannick Bisson, Helene Joy, Thomas Craig, Jonny Harris. In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

programme.review:
IMDb data; ttnr: 1091909, Title: Murdoch Mysteries, --- Description: Murdoch Mysteries: Created by Cal Coons, Alexandra Zarowny, Maureen Jennings, Bob Carney. With Yannick Bisson, Helene Joy, Thomas Craig, Jonny Harris. In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt1091909/","name":"Murdoch Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjMwNjkzNDU4Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDUxMTAyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the 1890s, William Murdoch uses radical forensic techniques for the time, including fingerprinting and trace evidence, to solve some of the city's most gruesome murders.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1091909/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"janice-lowing","dateCreated":"2012-12-28","inLanguage":"English","name":"Message from 'down under'","reviewBody":"There are so few shows that I thoroughly enjoy. Murchoch Mysteries is one of 4 particular shows that I watch regularly - and tape so that I do not miss them.

There are three main reasons that I like MM.

First, it is such a pleasure to watch something that does not have swearing, sex scenes, and gratuitous violence. Even though there are the odd (bordering on) romantic interludes the story line remains true to the theme of the title and they do not over-shadow the stories.

Second, I quite like viewing shows that depict times gone by and it is interesting to see how detectives'/police duties were (supposedly) undertaken in that time.

Third, the acting and story telling - as noted in a previous post - equals that of Midsummer Murders, Poirot (another favourite of mine), Judge John Deed (again, another favourite).

I like each character who has a distinct role and adds to the show as well as the enjoyment of watching the show. I do hope that there are quite a few new series planned.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":12369,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2,"contentRating":"TV-PG","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-01-01","keywords":"detective,police detective,morgue,police station,whodunit","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0084370/","name":"Yannick Bisson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0431420/","name":"Helene Joy","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0186030/","name":"Thomas Craig"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0014501/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382999/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0052272/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1779939/","name":"Cal Coons","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0953567/","name":"Alexandra Zarowny","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1485610/","name":"Maureen Jennings"],"trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2131996697","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNmIwY2Y4ZGMtOTlmNi00ZDA4LTg5MGMtM2NjN2E0YTY3ZTgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Murdoch Mysteries: Season 8"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
Dr. Blake
programme.desc: The Doctor Blake Mysteries: Created by George Adams, Tony Wright. With Nadine Garner, Craig McLachlan, Charlie Cousins, Joel Tobeck. Dr Lucien Blake left Ballarat as a young man. But now he finds himself returning, to take over not only his dead father's medical practice, but also his on-call role as the town's police surgeon." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2375720/","name":"The Doctor Blake Mysteries","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjgxODNlZDYtZjhkNS00OWI1LWE5ZGQtZGIxNjZlZjQ1MmY5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjExMjk0ODk@._V1_.jpg","description":"Dr Lucien Blake left Ballarat as a young man. But now he finds himself returning, to take over not only his dead father's medical practice, but also his on-call role as the town's police surgeon.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2375720/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Zen416"},"dateCreated":"2015-10-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"Smart little medical mystery show","reviewBody":"A nice little gem out of Australia. The premise about Dr. Lucien Blake, a police surgeon (kind of like an earlier era law enforcement medical examiner) who can't escape the shadow of his super successful father, also a doctor is intriguing. Blake (portrayed with a steady hand by Craig McLachlan) makes a few totally human assumptions along the way in each weeks mystery. This means he messes up and sometimes is lead down the wrong path before finding the right one. I like this because it means there aren't too many ridiculous jumps in logic when the sleuthing happens and the clues are followed. Sometimes the mysteries can be solved by the audience before the end but sometimes not. Again, I like something that makes me think a bit. Its also nice to watch a show from Australia that doesn't feature the tired stories about bubble heads hanging out on a beach or some forgettable vapid slapstick comedy thing. Great show, solid cast, nice tidy little, well-written under-an-hour whodunits. Grab a cup of tea or Java and have a sit-down and watch this show if you like mysteries.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4093,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.1},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2013-02-01","keywords":"doctor","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0307739/","name":"Nadine Garner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0572112/","name":"Craig McLachlan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0184083/","name":"Charlie Cousins"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0392993/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0010984/","name":"George Adams"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1131770/","name":"Tony Wright"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3801727257","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDc4MmFiZGUtZDllYy00ZjRkLWE5NDEtNTE2YTkzMGIwYjI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDc4MmFiZGUtZDllYy00ZjRkLWE5NDEtNTE2YTkzMGIwYjI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation
Ekipa za očevid
programme.desc: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation: Created by Anthony E. Zuiker. With George Eads, Eric Szmanda, Robert David Hall, Paul Guilfoyle. Series following an elite team of police forensic evidence investigation experts as they work their cases in Las Vegas." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0247082/","name":"CSI: Crime Scene Investigation","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjRlZjFmNTktYzg0ZC00OWJlLWJlN2EtOGQ1OTRiOTFiMWE3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTA4NzY1MzY@._V1_.jpg","description":"Series following an elite team of police forensic evidence investigation experts as they work their cases in Las Vegas.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0247082/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"TheLittleSongbird"},"dateCreated":"2010-04-21","inLanguage":"English","name":"A great show, but not as good as it used to be","reviewBody":"I love these kinds of shows, so I came across CSI:Crime Scene Inestigation by accident while flicking through channels, and since that moment I have been hooked. I like how each crime is looked at from a different perspective, it offers a whole new slant on things, although some of the more disturbing/graphic images may turn your stomach a little. Also, I love the colours the series is shot in, reds, blues, greens and yellow, really a treat to the eye, and the photography is very impressive. And the music is funky and cool, well the theme song is from The Who, they ooze with coolness. I like the writing, Grissom's dialogue and asides are a joy to behold especially, and the methodical but well structured story lines. The season finales nearly always manage to be gripping and compelling. And the acting is great, William Peterson was wonderful as Grissom, and although I was sad to see him go, the character's departure was handled very well so I was glad of that. The reason why it isn't quite as good as it could have been is because somehow I don't find it as well thought out as the earlier seasons. And while Laurence Fishburne is a great actor and does a good job, I kind of miss Grissom if you get the jist. That said though, this is a great show. 8/10 Bethany Cox","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":80918,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.6},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Crime","Drama","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2000-10-06","keywords":"crime scene investigation,las vegas nevada,crime lab,police,detective","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000401/","name":"Laurence Fishburne"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001339/","name":"Marg Helgenberger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0247040/","name":"George Eads"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0048735/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0958499/","name":"Anthony E. Zuiker"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"CSI: Season 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2534388761","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODk2MmYxYTEtNjljNC00MGYwLWJkOWMtZDZjMmFlMjc5YzhjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODk2MmYxYTEtNjljNC00MGYwLWJkOWMtZDZjMmFlMjc5YzhjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"}}</script><metacontent="
